sections.body: Some rangers, particularly those in primitive lands or who were raised by animals, have unusually strong bonds with animals. Unique among rangers, they can bond with multiple animals of any kind, creating a menagerie of wild yet loyal creatures, like a strange family. A beast master has the following class features.
sections.name: Beast Master
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Beast Master

sections.body: A beast master's class skills are Acrobatics (Dex), Climb (Str), Craft (Int), Escape Artist (Dex), Handle Animal (Cha), Heal (Wis), Intimidate (Cha), Knowledge (nature) (Int), Perception (Wis), Ride (Dex), Stealth (Dex), Survival (Wis), and Swim (Wis). These replace the standard ranger class skills.
sections.name: Class Skills

sections.body:
A beast master forms a close bond with an animal companion. This ability functions like the druid animal companion ability except that the ranger's effective druid level is equal to his ranger level – 3. The ranger gains a +2 bonus on wild empathy and Handle Animal checks made regarding his animal companion. Unlike a normal ranger, a beast master's choice of animal companion is not limited to a subset of all possibile animal companion choices—he may choose freely among all animal companion choices, just as a druid can.

The beast master may have more than one animal companion, but he must divide up his effective druid level between his companions to determine the abilities of each companion. For example, a beast master with an effective druid level of 4 can have one 4th-level companion, two 2nd-level companions, or one 1st-level and one 3rd-level companion. Each time a beast master's effective druid level increases, he must decide how to allocate the increase among his animal companions (including the option of adding a new 1st-level companion). Once an effective druid level is allocated to a particular companion, it cannot be redistributed while that companion is in the ranger's service (he must release a companion or wait until a companion dies to allocate its levels to another companion). The share spells animal companion ability does not give the ranger the ability to cast a single spell so that it affects all of his animal companions. This ability replaces hunter's bond.
sections.name: Animal Companion
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Beast Master/Animal Companion

sections.body: The beast master gains an empathic link with all of his animal companions. This functions like an empathic link with a familiar, except the ranger can also see through a companion's eyes as a swift action, maintaining this connection as long as he likes (as long as the companion is within 1 mile) and ending it as a free action. The ranger can only see through the eyes of one companion at a time, and is blinded while maintaining this connection. This replaces the 6th-level combat style feat.
sections.name: Improved Empathic Link
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Beast Master/Improved Empathic Link

sections.body: At 12th level, the ranger strengthens his bond with his animal companions. The ranger's effective druid level for his animal companions is now equal to his ranger level; he may immediately allocate these additional levels to his companions as he sees fit. This ability replaces camouflage.
sections.name: Strong Bond
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Beast Master/Strong Bond

sections.body: Many rangers are loners, but some choose to use their familiarity with the land to guide others safely through the wilderness. The guide forgoes a favored enemy to focus on the task or foe at hand, and can pass his knowledge and luck on to his charges. A guide has the following class features.
sections.name: Guide
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Guide

sections.body:
At 1st level, once per day, the guide can focus on a single enemy within line of sight as a swift action. That creature remains the ranger's focus until it is reduced to 0 or fewer hit points or surrenders, or until the ranger designates a new focus, whichever occurs first. The ranger gains a +2 bonus on attack and damage rolls against the target of his focus. At 5th level, and every five levels thereafter, this bonus increases by +2.

At 4th level, and every 3 levels thereafter, the ranger can use this ability one additional time per day. This ability replaces favored enemy.
sections.name: Ranger's Focus
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Guide/Rangers Focus

sections.body: At 4th level, the guide forms a bond with the land itself, enabling him to direct others in such terrain. When in his favored terrain, the ranger grants all allies within line of sight and that can hear him a +2 bonus on initiative checks and Perception, Stealth, and Survival skill checks. Also, as long as they travel with him, the ranger's allies leave no trail and can't be tracked. The ranger can choose for the group to leave a trail, or even specific members of the group to leave a trail if he so desires. This ability replaces hunter's bond.
sections.name: Terrain Bond
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Guide/Terrain Bond

sections.body: Upon reaching 9th level, once per day the guide can either reroll one of his attack rolls or force an enemy who just hit him with an attack to reroll the attack roll. The ranger must take the result of the second roll even if it is worse. A ranger can use this ability once per day at 9th level, plus one additional time per day at 14th and 19th levels. This ability replaces evasion.
sections.name: Ranger's Luck
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Guide/Rangers Luck

sections.body: At 11th level, the guide can have an inspired moment once per day as a free action. The ranger gains the following benefits until the end of his next turn. His speed increases by 10 feet. He can take an extra move or swift action on his turn. He gains a +4 bonus to AC and on attack rolls, skill checks, or ability checks. Finally, he automatically confirms any critical threat he scores. He can use this ability one additional time per day at 19th level. This ability replaces quarry and improved quarry.
sections.name: Inspired Moment
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Guide/Inspired Moment

sections.body: Upon reaching 16th level, the ranger's luck increases. He gains a +4 bonus on his rerolls made with the ranger's luck ability, or if he forces an enemy to reroll an attack, that enemy takes a –4 penalty on the roll. This bonus or penalty is also applied on any roll to confirm critical hits. This ability replaces improved evasion.
sections.name: Improved Ranger's Luck
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Guide/Improved Rangers Luck

sections.body: Rangers of the plains use horses or other riding beasts to hunt their lands, forging a near-mystical relationship with their mounts. Horse lords are unparalleled mounted combatants, the envy of even the most dedicated cavalier. Though called “horse lords” as a generic term, these rangers are not restricted to horses for their animal companions—any creature the ranger can ride is included in these abilities. A horse lord has the following class features.
sections.name: Horse Lord
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Horse Lord

sections.body: At 2nd level, a horse lord must choose the mounted combat style.
sections.name: Combat Style Feat
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Horse Lord/Combat Style Feat

sections.body: At 4th level, the horse lord forms a bond with an animal he can use as a mount, which becomes his animal companion. A Medium ranger can select a camel or a horse. A small ranger can select a pony or wolf, but can also select a boar or dog if he is at least 7th level. This ability functions like the druid animal companion ability except that the ranger's effective druid level is equal to his ranger level – 3. The ranger gains a +2 bonus on Handle Animal and Ride checks with his animal companion mount. This ability replaces hunter's bond.
sections.name: Mounted Bond
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Horse Lord/Mounted Bond

sections.body: At 12th level, the horse lord strengthens his bond with his mount. The ranger's effective druid level for his mount is now equal to his ranger level. This ability replaces camouflage.
sections.name: Strong Bond
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Horse Lord/Strong Bond

sections.body: At 17th level, the horse lord can grant his animal companion temporary hit points equal to his ranger level once per day. While these temporary hit points last, when his mount is within 30 feet of the him, he can choose to share the damage taken by his mount as if using shield other. This ability replaces hide in plain sight.
sections.name: Spiritual Bond
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Horse Lord/Spiritual Bond

sections.body: Some rangers study their favored enemies and learn their ways, applying this knowledge to their own abilities and using their foes' strengths against them. Infiltrators are willing to walk a mile in an enemy's shoes so as to learn eveything there is to know about their foes in order to more effectively hunt and kill them.
sections.name: Infiltrator
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator

sections.body:
At 3rd level, an infiltrator learns how to copy the unusual abilities of his prey. He chooses one type of creature he has selected as a favored enemy, such as “aberrations.” The ranger selects one ability or feat from the adaptation list for that type (see below). A ranger can use adaptations for 10 minutes per day per ranger level he possesses. This duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be used in 10-minute increments. If the adaptation requires the ranger to make a more specific choice (such as what skill to use with Skill Focus), this choice is permanent and cannot be changed.

At 8th, 13th, and 15th-level, the ranger chooses another one of his favored enemy types and selects one adaptation from that type's list, as well as an additional adaptation from any one list of a creature type he's selected (including the one just chosen, if so desired). The infiltrator can only use one adaptation at a time. This class ability replaces favored terrain.
sections.name: Adaptation
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation

sections.body: amphibious, darkvision 60 ft., Iron Will, natural armor +2.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Aberration
sections.name: Aberration

sections.body: climb 15 ft., darkvision 60 ft., Great Fortitude, Lightning Reflexes, low-light vision, natural armor (+2), swim 15 ft.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Animal
sections.name: Animal

sections.body: darkvision 60 ft., Great Fortitude, Lightning Reflexes, low-light vision.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Construct
sections.name: Construct

sections.body: darkvision 60 ft., Great Fortitude, Iron Will, Lightning Reflexes, low-light vision, Lunge.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Dragon
sections.name: Dragon

sections.body: Iron Will, Lightning Reflexes, low-light vision.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Fey
sections.name: Fey

sections.body: low-light vision, natural armor +2, darkvision, swim 15 ft.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Humanoid (aquatic)
sections.name: Humanoid (aquatic)

sections.body: darkvision 60 ft., defensive training, greed, hatred, hardy, slow and steady, stability, stonecunning, weapon familiarity.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Humanoid (dwarf)
sections.name: Humanoid (dwarf)

sections.body: elf blood, low-light vision, elven immunities, elven magic, keen senses, Skill Focus (choose one skill), weapon familiarity.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Humanoid (elf)
sections.name: Humanoid (elf)

sections.body: low-light vision, Lunge, natural armor +2, resist energy 10 (choose cold, electricity, or fire), Throw Anything.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Humanoid (giant)
sections.name: Humanoid (giant)

sections.body: darkvision 60 ft., Exotic Weapon Proficiency (dire flail), natural armor +2.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Humanoid (gnoll)
sections.name: Humanoid (gnoll)

sections.body: defensive training, gnome magic, hatred, illusion resistance, keen senses, low-light vision, obsessive, weapon familiarity.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Humanoid (gnome)
sections.name: Humanoid (gnome)

sections.body: darkvision 60 ft., goblin fast, Skill Focus (Stealth), natural armor (+2).
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Humanoid (goblinoid)
sections.name: Humanoid (goblinoid)

sections.body: fearless, halfling luck, keen senses, sure-footed, weapon familiarity.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Humanoid (halfling)
sections.name: Humanoid (halfling)

sections.body: Great Fortitude, Iron Will, Lightning Reflexes, Skill Focus (choose one skill).
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Humanoid (human)
sections.name: Humanoid (human)

sections.body: darkvision 60 ft., ferocity, intimidating, orc blood, weapon familiarity.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Humanoid (orc)
sections.name: Humanoid (orc)

sections.body: darkvision 60 ft., kobold fast (as goblin fast), lizardfolk hold breath, natural armor +2, Skill Focus (choose Acrobatics, Perception, or Stealth).
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Humanoid (reptilian)
sections.name: Humanoid (reptilian)

sections.body: darkvision 60 ft., Great Fortitude, low-light vision, natural armor +2.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Magical Beast
sections.name: Magical Beast

sections.body: darkvision 60 ft., Lightning Reflexes, low-light vision, natural armor +2.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Monstrous Humanoid
sections.name: Monstrous Humanoid

sections.body: acid resistance 10, Great Fortitude, Iron Will, Skill Focus (choose Climb, Escape Artist, or Perception).
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Ooze
sections.name: Ooze

sections.body: darkvision 60 ft., energy resistance 5 (choose one type of energy from acid, cold, electricity, or fire), Great Fortitude, Iron Will, Lightning Reflexes.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Outsider
sections.name: Outsider

sections.body: low-light vision, Great Fortitude, Iron Will.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Plant
sections.name: Plant

sections.body: darkvision 60 ft., Great Fortitude, Iron Will, natural armor (+2). Skill Focus (Stealth).
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Undead
sections.name: Undead

sections.body: climb 15 ft., darkvision 60 ft., Great Fortitude, Iron Will, swim 15 ft.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Infiltrator/Adaptation/Vermin
sections.name: Vermin

sections.body: Most rangers venture into the wilderness, but there are some who let the wilderness seep into them. Whether by curse, disease, ancient rite, a slight lycanthropic influence in the blood, or the corrupting influence of chaos, these rangers embrace the wild to transform themselves into something untamed and feral. Shapeshifters are often held in awe, but are even more often feared. A shapeshifter has the following class features.
sections.name: Shapeshifter
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter

sections.body: At 2nd level, a shapeshifter ranger must choose the natural weapon combat style.
sections.name: Combat Style Feat
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Combat Style Feat

sections.body:
At 3rd level, the shapeshifter can take on the aspects of a wild creature once per day as a swift action. He can remain in this form for a number of rounds equal to his ranger level + his Wisdom modifier. While in one of his shifter's blessing forms, the ranger gains the shapeshifter subtype.

The shapeshifter must choose one of the following forms. Once this choice is made, it cannot be changed.
sections.name: Shifter's Blessing
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Shifters Blessing

sections.body: The ranger's muscles enlarge and tighten, and his facial features become more ursine. While in this form, the ranger gains a +4 enhancement bonus to Strength, but his base speed becomes 20 feet.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Shifters Blessing/Form of the Bear
sections.name: Form of the Bear

sections.body: The ranger's muscles become lean and defined, and his gait more deliberate and graceful. While in this form, the ranger increases his base speed by 10 feet, and he gains a +4 bonus on Acrobatics and Climb checks.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Shifters Blessing/Form of the Cat
sections.name: Form of the Cat

sections.body: The ranger's skin becomes rough and scaly. While in this form, the ranger gains a +2 natural armor bonus to AC.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Shifters Blessing/Form of the Dragon
sections.name: Form of the Dragon

sections.body: The ranger's skin stretches, his nose becomes hooked, and his eyes enlarge. While in this form, the ranger gains a +10 bonus on Perception checks.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Shifters Blessing/Form of the Eagle
sections.name: Form of the Eagle

sections.body: The ranger becomes thin and hyperactive, his movements taking on a nervous spryness. While in this form, the ranger can spend a move action to move up to 1/2 his speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Shifters Blessing/Form of the Jackal
sections.name: Form of the Jackal

sections.body:
The ranger's hands and feet grow webs, and his body grows an oily fur that is water resistant. While in this form, the ranger gains a swim speed of 30 feet and a +8 bonus on Swim checks.

At 8th level and again every five levels thereafter, the ranger may select an additional form for his shifter's blessing and may use this ability one additional time per day. This is not a polymorph ability; a ranger with shifter's blessing in one of his shifted forms can be affected by a polymorph ability and retain his bonus and traits gained by the class feature. This ability replaces favored terrain.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Shifters Blessing/Form of the Otter
sections.name: Form of the Otter

sections.body: At 12th level, when the shapeshifter takes on a shifter's blessing form, he can take on a hybrid of two of his forms. He gains the bonuses for both forms. This ability replaces camouflage.
sections.name: Dual Form Shifter
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Dual Form Shifter

sections.body: At 20th level, the ranger's shifter's blessing forms improve, and he can take on true forms of beasts. The ranger can use dual form shifter with this ability, although he cannot use more than one polymorph effect at any one time. This ability replaces master hunter. The ranger's forms from shifter's blessing improve to the following:
sections.name: Master Shifter
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Master Shifter

sections.body: The ranger's muscles enlarge and tighten, and his facial features become more ursine. While in this form, the ranger gains a +8 enhancement bonus to Strength and he does not suffer any reduction of speed. Alternatively, the ranger can polymorph into the form of a bear as if the caster of beast shape IV.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Master Shifter/Form of the Bear
sections.name: Form of the Bear

sections.body: The ranger's muscles become lean and defined, and his gait more deliberate and graceful. While in this form, the ranger increases his base speed by 20 feet and he gains a +10 bonus on Acrobatics and Climb checks. Alternatively, the ranger can polymorph into the form of a cat of any size as if the caster of beast shape IV.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Master Shifter/Form of the Cat
sections.name: Form of the Cat

sections.body: The ranger's skin becomes rough and scaly. While in this form, the ranger gains a +4 natural armor bonus to AC and a fly speed of 30 feet with average maneuverability. Alternately, the ranger can polymorph into the form of a dragon as if the caster of form of the dragon I.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Master Shifter/Form of the Dragon
sections.name: Form of the Dragon

sections.body: The ranger's skin stretches, his nose becomes hooked, and his eyes enlarge. While in this form, the ranger gains a +10 bonus on Perception checks and a fly speed of 40 feet with good maneuverability. Alternatively, the ranger can polymorph into the form of an eagle or similar raptor as if the caster of beast shape IV.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Master Shifter/Form of the Eagle
sections.name: Form of the Eagle

sections.body: The ranger becomes thin and hyperactive, his movements taking on a nervous spryness. While in this form, the ranger does not provoke attacks of opportunity due to movement. Alternatively, the ranger can polymorph into the form of a jackal or other canine creature as if the caster of beast shape IV.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Master Shifter/Form of the Jackal
sections.name: Form of the Jackal

sections.body: The ranger's hands and feet grow webs, and his body grows an oily fur that is water resistant. While in this form, the ranger gains a swim speed of 60 feet and a +5 bonus on Swim checks. Alternatively, the ranger can polymorph into the form of an otter or similar river mammal as if the caster of beast shape IV.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Shapeshifter/Master Shifter/Form of the Otter
sections.name: Form of the Otter

sections.body: Many rangers rely on spells, but there are some who eschew aid from divine powers for their own reasons. Skirmishers rely on their wits, their wisdom, and sometimes even instinct to aid in their quests. A skirmisher has the following class features.
sections.name: Skirmisher
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher

sections.body:
At 5th level, a skirmisher ranger learns the use of hunter's tricks, which typically grant a boon or bonus to the ranger or a nearby ally. At 5th level, the ranger learns one trick, selected from the list below. At 7th level, and every two levels thereafter, he learns another trick. A ranger can use these tricks a total number of times per day equal to 1/2 his ranger level + his Wisdom modifier. Tricks are usually swift actions, but sometimes move or free actions that modify a standard action, usually an attack action. Once a trick is chosen, it can't be retrained. A ranger cannot select an individual trick more than once. This ability replaces the ranger's spells class feature. Skirmishers do not gain any spells or spellcasting ability, do not have a caster level, and cannot use spell trigger and spell completion magic items.

The following is a list of hunter tricks and their effects.
sections.name: Hunter's Tricks
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks

sections.body: The ranger can use this trick as a free action when he hits a creature with an attack. The next ally who makes an attack against the target creature before the start of the ranger's next turn gains a +2 circumstance bonus on that attack roll.
sections.name: Aiding Attack
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Aiding Attack

sections.body: The ranger can use this trick as an immediate action when his animal companion is hit with an attack or a combat maneuver. The companion's AC and combat maneuver defense increase by +4 for the purposes of that attack. If the attack still hits, the animal companion only takes half damage (if any). The animal companion must be able to see and hear the ranger to benefit from this trick.
sections.name: Bolster Companion
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Bolster Companion

sections.body: The ranger can use this trick as an immediate action when he falls 20 or more feet, ignoring the first 20 feet of the fall when calculating the falling damage. If the ranger takes no damage from the fall, he does not fall prone.
sections.name: Catfall
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Catfall

sections.body: The ranger can move up to twice his speed as a move action. The ranger does not take any penalty on Stealth checks for movement during this move. This move provokes attacks of opportunity as normal.
sections.name: Chameleon Step
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Chameleon Step

sections.body: As a standard action, the ranger can communicate with a single creature as if using the tongues spell for 10 minutes. Because the communication is slow and lacks subtlety, the ranger suffers a –4 penalty on all Bluff and Diplomacy checks relating to the creature he is communicating with when using this trick.
sections.name: Cunning Pantomime
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Cunning Pantomime

sections.body: The ranger can use this trick as a swift action. Until the start of his next turn, his ranged attacks do not provoke attacks of opportunity.
sections.name: Defensive Bow Stance
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Defensive Bow Stance

sections.body: The ranger can spend a move action to stand up without provoking attacks of opportunity.
sections.name: Deft Stand
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Deft Stand

sections.body: The ranger can use this trick as a free action before he makes an attack. If the attack hits, the target takes a –2 penalty on all attack rolls for 1 round.
sections.name: Distracting Attack
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Distracting Attack

sections.body: The ranger can use this trick as a free action when he makes an attack against one of his favored enemies. The ranger doubles the threat range of his weapon for this attack. This does not stack with other abilities that increase a weapon's threat range.
sections.name: Hateful Attack
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Hateful Attack

sections.body: The ranger can use this trick as an immediate action when his animal companion moves. When the companion moves, the square it starts out in is not considered threatened by any opponent it can see, and therefore visible enemies do not get attacks of opportunity against it when it moves from that square. The companion must end this movement in a square adjacent to the ranger. The animal companion must be able to see and hear the ranger to take this movement.
sections.name: Heel
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Heel

sections.body: The ranger can use this trick as a free action when he hits with an attack. The target of the attack's land speed is reduced by 1/2 for 1d4 rounds.
sections.name: Hobbling Attack
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Hobbling Attack

sections.body: The ranger can climb at his full speed as a move action without penalty.
sections.name: Quick Climb
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Quick Climb

sections.body: As a swift action, the ranger can make a Heal check to administer first aid on an adjacent dying character. Alternatively, the ranger can administer a potion to an unconscious character as a move action.
sections.name: Quick Healing
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Quick Healing

sections.body: The ranger can swim at his full speed as a move action without penalty.
sections.name: Quick Swim
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Quick Swim

sections.body: As a swift action, the ranger can grant all allies within 30 feet that are within line of sight and can hear him a +2 bonus on skill checks with a single skill of his choice. The ranger must have at least one rank in the chosen skill. This bonus lasts for 1 round.
sections.name: Ranger's Counsel
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Rangers Counsel

sections.body: The ranger can use this trick as a free action before he makes a melee attack. If the attack hits, the target is shaken for 1d4 rounds.
sections.name: Rattling Strike
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Rattling Strike

sections.body: When he misses with a melee attack, the ranger may reroll his attack at a –5 penalty. Using this ability is an immediate action.
sections.name: Second Chance Strike
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Second Chance Strike

sections.body: The ranger can use this trick as a swift action. His animal companion makes one melee attack against an adjacent creature. The animal companion must be able to see and hear the ranger to make this attack.
sections.name: Sic 'Em
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Sic Em

sections.body: As a free action, the ranger can roll twice on any one skill check and take the better result. He must have at least 1 rank in that skill to use this ability.
sections.name: Skill Sage
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Skill Sage

sections.body: As a free action, the ranger can attempt a running jump without moving 10 feet before the jump.
sections.name: Stag's Leap
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Stags Leap

sections.body: The ranger can move 5 feet as a swift action. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity and does not count as a 5-foot step.
sections.name: Surprise Shift
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Surprise Shift

sections.body: The ranger can use this attack as a free action when he makes an attack. If the attack hits, the target is entangled for 1 round.
sections.name: Tangling Attack
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Tangling Attack

sections.body: As a standard action, the ranger can make a ranged attack that ignores concealment (but not total concealment), soft cover, and partial cover.
sections.name: Trick Shot
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Trick Shot

sections.body: As an immediate action, the ranger gains a +10 insight bonus on Perception checks for 1 round.
sections.name: Uncanny Senses
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Uncanny Senses

sections.body: The ranger can use this trick as a free action just before he makes a melee attack. If the attack hits, he may make a free trip combat maneuver against the target.
sections.name: Upending Strike
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Upending Strike

sections.body: The ranger can use this trick as an immediate action when an enemy adjacent to him hits an ally with a melee or ranged attack. The ranger can make a single melee attack at his highest base attack bonus against the creature who attacked his ally.
sections.name: Vengeance Strike
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Skirmisher/Hunters Tricks/Vengeance Strike

sections.body: Some rangers nurture a connection with the spirits that reside in all things. By communing with these spirits, the spirit ranger can gain glimpses of things to come. A spirit ranger has the following class features.
sections.name: Spirit Ranger
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Spirit Ranger

sections.body: At 4th level, instead of forming a bond with his hunting companions or an animal companion, the spirit ranger forms a bond with the spirits of nature themselves. Each day, as long as he is within one of his favored terrains, the ranger can cast augury as a spell-like ability with a caster level equal to his ranger level. In addition, he can call upon these spirits to cast any one ranger spell that he is capable of casting, without having to prepare the spell. At 8th level, and every four levels thereafter, he can cast an additional spell in this way. This replaces hunter's bond.
sections.name: Spirit Bond
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Spirit Ranger/Spirit Bond

sections.body: At 12th level, the spirit ranger can use his augury spell-like ability even when he is not in one of his favored terrains. If he is within one of his favored terrains, the ranger can cast divination instead. Like augury, the caster level of the divination is equal to the ranger's level. This ability replaces camouflage.
sections.name: Wisdom of the Spirits
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Spirit Ranger/Wisdom of the Spirits

sections.body: For the urban ranger, the streets and sewers of the city are just as dangerous as the barren wastelands or the deep forests. An urban ranger has the following class features.
sections.name: Urban Ranger
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Urban Ranger

sections.body: At 1st level, an urban ranger adds Disable Device and Knowledge (local) to his list of class skills and removes Handle Animal and Knowledge (nature) from his list of class skills.
sections.name: Urban Ranger

sections.body:
At 3rd level, the urban ranger forms a bond with a community. While inside the limits of this community, he gains a +2 bonus on initiative checks and Knowledge (local), Perception, Stealth, and Survival skill checks. An urban ranger traveling through his favored community leaves no trail and cannot be tracked (although he may leave a trail if he so desires).

At 8th level, and every five levels thereafter, an urban ranger may select an additional favored community. In addition, at each such interval, the skill bonus and initiative bonus in any one favored community (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.

For the purposes of this ability, a community is any settlement consisting of 100 or more individuals. The community may be larger than this minimum. Outlying farms, fields, and houses are not considered part of a community. This ability replaces favored terrain.
sections.name: Favored Community
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Urban Ranger/Favored Community

sections.body: At 3rd level, an urban ranger can find and disable traps, as the rogue class feature of the same name. This ability replaces endurance.
sections.name: Trapfinding
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Urban Ranger/Trapfinding

sections.body: At 7th level, an urban ranger is never slowed by difficult terrain in his favored communities. In addition, he can move through the space occupied by local citizens as if they were allies. This does not apply to creatures intent on harming the ranger. Areas that are enchanted or magically manipulated to impede motion, however, still affect him. This replaces woodland stride.
sections.name: Push Through
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Urban Ranger/Push Through

sections.body: An urban ranger of 12th level or higher can use his Stealth bonus in place of a Disguise skill check in any of his favored communities. This disguise does not take an action to don. He must make a check whenever someone attempts to pick him out from the local citizens. If his check is successful, he blends into the crowd. While not invisible, enemies do not notice his presence and take no actions against him unless they are taking actions against the local citizens in general. This replaces camouflage.
sections.name: Blend In
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Urban Ranger/Blend In

sections.body: At 17th level, the urban ranger can cast greater invisibility on himself as a wizard of his ranger level as a swift action. He can use this spell-like ability a number of times per day equal to his Wisdom modifier (minimum 1). This ability replaces hide in plain sight.
sections.name: Invisibility Trick
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Ranger/Ranger Archetypes/Urban Ranger/Invisibility Trick
